channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytip mattress, 12th November
item.description:
Dumped childs mattress outside flats on bourdon road. been there since saturday .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourdon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shoulder of Mutton Green Welling, 12th November
item.description:
2 dead trees have been removed on shoulder of mutton green, but stumps have been left, surely contractors should remove the stumps as well
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous wall, 12th November
item.description:
The walk is adjacent to a disused garden that is now in bad need of repair, this wall will come down it’s just a matter of when and could injure or kill someone.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cleanthus Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction at northern corner of Russell Square, 12th November
item.description:
Incredibly dangerous!! Can't believe that other reports on Fixmystreet and TfL have been closed on the grounds that this has been 'reported' to the operators. It needs fixing as an emergency. The temporary traffic lights stay red for many minutes at a time and then go green for multiple streams of traffic and pedestrians at once. This is a serious accident waiting to happen. It's clearly not fixed as I can hear the honking from here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Russell Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Central reservation lampost height bollard light not working, 12th November
item.description:
The tall bollard type street lamp in the middle of the road is not working. Location is postcode SW5 9LP near corner of Denmark Road and Knatchbull Road. This is dangerous as it is a busy crossing and is now very dark at night. See photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knatchbull Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Obstruction by fallen leaves on the road and on the pavement

item.title: Pile of growing rubbish & leaves, 12th November
item.description:
This pile of rubbish started as a bucket and now has boxes, shoes, glass and various other items. Aside from being an eyesore it is partially blocking the pavement and this and the slippery leaves should ideally be cleared asap. Thanks so much

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Upper Clapton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car has been left and hasn’t moved for over 7-8weeks, 12th November
item.description:
A car has parked in a bay for over 7weeks and hasn’t moved . It isn’t any of the neighbours as I have knocked and asked . Parking is very bad and limited on this road as it is .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Normandy Way, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
A fridge freezer had been fly tipped by someone

item.title: Street light not working, 12th November
item.description:
One street light is not working on the north east side of Battersea park, the others around it are working.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carriage Drive North, Battersea, London

item.title: Street lights not working, 12th November
item.description:
Between the two bridges there are 8 street lights not working on the waterfront, two on the west side the other 6 on the east side towards Battersea power station. Middle lights are working.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 376, Queenstown Road, London

item.title: The vehicle is blocking a public footpath, my back exit and emergency exit., 12th November
item.description:
This vehicle has been there for over 4 months, it's now causing nuisance people are now flytipping around the vehicles

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, London

item.title: Bin not emptied, 12th November
item.description:
Another week and bins not emptoed and taken away. Months and months where they are blocking the pavement and making a mess of the street. Please empty or remove the bins!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Combedale Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: So much rubbish, 12th November
item.description:
There is SO much rubbish constantly on the pavements and road around here. This was reported a few days ago but has not been resolved. Someone needs to be regularly coming round and picking up litter - it is making the road look disgusting and unhygienic.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glyn Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light hidden behind other sign, 12th November
item.description:
Traffic light is hidden behind other sign - cannot see light changing - ridiculous!! Also no road markings to indicate where trafgic should sit to to turn right

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ignatius Sancho Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The male hairdresser at Perfectress Hairdressing on Crawford Street keeps attaching his bike to our Crawford Mansions railings, 12th November
item.description:
Instead of using cycle bays or renting enclosed bicycle parking on a neighbouring street, he attaches his bicycle onto private property. We are awaiting signs from WCC. He has taken the paint off the railings in places and has tried to hide the damage by covering with black tape. He's been asked to remove it, I've pointed out the damage, he just laughed!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crawford Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of wood and general waste, 12th November
item.description:
Usual spot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
